cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds contribute to the stability of ecosystems.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Mechanism: through roles like seed dispersal and pest control

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ecological roles of birds help maintain balance within ecosystems.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes causally to the stability or balanced functioning of the ecosystem or ecological system represented by the object.
args.justification: Both relations describe a causal stabilizing/balancing effect of birds or their ecological roles on ecosystems or their stability; using a single predicate 'stabilizes' captures this shared semantics regardless of whether the object is the ecosystem itself or its stability state.
Both relations express how organisms or their ecological roles affect the stability or balance of ecosystems, which fits a shared class focused on ecosystem stability effects.
Each relation encodes a causal influence (birds or their roles causing increased stability/balance of ecosystems), which belongs under a broad causal semantics group.
